1394922_18_ITEM15_P5_S0	This Code of Ethics is applicable to ATEL 12, LLC ( Fund 12 ), including the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer of its Manager, ATEL Financial Services, LLC ( AFS ), or persons acting in such capacity (collectively the Covered Officers ) on behalf of Fund 12, referred to herein as the Company.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P6_S0	Accordingly, under the Securities and Exchange Commission s interpretation of its disclosure rules, the Board of Directors of the Manager of ATEL Financial Services, LLC ( AFS ), functions as the de facto audit committee for the Company with respect to all procedural and disclosure requirements applicable to audit committees under Securities and Exchange Commission rules.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P6_S1	The Board of Directors shall have oversight responsibility over the activities of the Company for purposes of this Code of Ethics.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P7_S0	The Company is proud of the values with which it conducts business.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P7_S1	It has and will continue to uphold the highest levels of business ethics and personal integrity in all types of transactions and interactions.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P7_S2	To this end, this Code of Ethics serves to (1) emphasize the Company s commitment to ethics and compliance with the law; (2) set forth basic standards of ethical and legal behavior; (3) provide reporting mechanisms for known or suspected ethical or legal violations; and (4) help prevent and detect wrongdoing.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P7_S3	This Code of Ethics is intended to augment and supplement the standard of ethics and business conduct expected of all Company employees, and its limitation to Covered Officers is not intended to limit the obligation of all Company employees to adhere to the highest standards of business ethics and integrity in all transactions and interactions conducted while in the Company s employ.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P8_S0	Given the variety and complexity of ethical questions that may arise in the course of business of the Company, this Code of Ethics serves only as a rough guide.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P8_S1	Confronted with ethically ambiguous situations, the Covered Officers should remember the Company s commitment to the highest ethical standards and seek independent advice, where necessary, to ensure that all actions they take on behalf of the Company honor this commitment.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P9_S0	The Covered Officers shall behave honestly and ethically at all times and with all people.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P9_S1	They shall act in good faith, with due care, and shall engage only in fair and open competition, by treating ethically competitors, suppliers, customers, and colleagues.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P9_S2	They shall not misrepresent facts or engage in illegal, unethical, or anti-competitive practices for personal or professional gain.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P10_S0	This fundamental standard of honest and ethical conduct extends to the handling of conflicts of interest.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P10_S1	The Covered Officers shall avoid any actual, potential, or apparent conflicts of interest with the Company, and any personal activities, investments, or associations that might give rise to such conflicts.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P10_S2	They shall not compete with or use the Company, for personal gain, self-deal, or take advantage of any corporate opportunities.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P10_S3	They shall act on behalf of the Company free from improper influence or the appearance of improper influence on their judgment or performance of duties.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P10_S4	A Covered Officer shall disclose any material transaction or relationship that reasonably could be expected to give rise to such a conflict to the Company s General Counsel or a member of the Company s Board of Directors.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P10_S5	No action may be taken with respect to such transaction or party unless and until the Company s Board of Directors has approved such action.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P11_S0	Notwithstanding the foregoing, it is understood, as fully disclosed in the offering documents for the Company, that AFS as managing member of the Company has certain inherent conflicts of interest.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P12_S0	transactions in which conflicts of interest may arise.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P12_S1	Furthermore, AFS has a fiduciary duty to the Company as its manager.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P12_S2	It is therefore expressly understood by the Company and the Covered Officers that any and all actions by AFS and its personnel that comply with the provisions of the Company s Operating Agreement, and which are consistent with AFS s fiduciary duty to the Company, will not be considered material transactions or relationships which require disclosure or reporting under this Code of Ethics.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P13_S0	In reports and documents filed with or submitted to the Securities and Exchange Commission and other regulators by the Company and in other public communications made by the Company, the Covered Officers shall make disclosures that are full, fair, accurate, timely, and understandable.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P13_S1	The Covered Officers shall provide thorough and accurate financial and accounting data for inclusion in such disclosures.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P13_S2	The Covered Officers shall not knowingly conceal or falsify information, misrepresent material facts, or omit material facts necessary to avoid misleading the Company s independent public auditors or investors.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P14_S0	In conducting the business of the Company, the Covered Officers shall comply with applicable governmental laws, rules, and regulations at all levels of government in the United States and in any non-U.S. jurisdiction in which the Company does business, as well as applicable rules and regulations of self-regulatory organizations of which the Company is a member.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P14_S1	If the Covered Officer is unsure whether a particular action would violate an applicable law, rule, or regulation, he or she should seek the advice of inside counsel (if available), and, where necessary, outside counsel before undertaking it.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P15_S0	The Covered Officers will promptly bring to the attention of the Company s General Counsel or the Board of Directors any information concerning a material violation of any of the laws, rules or regulations applicable to the Company and the operation of its businesses, by the Company or any agent thereof, or of violation of this Code of Ethics.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P15_S1	The Company s General Counsel will investigate reports of violations and the findings communicated to the Company s Board of Directors.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P16_S0	If the Company s Board of Directors determines that this Code of Ethics has been violated, either directly, by failure to report a violation, or by withholding information related to a violation, it may discipline the offending Covered Officer for non-compliance with penalties up to and including termination of employment.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P16_S1	Violations of this Code of Ethics may also constitute violations of law and may result in criminal penalties and civil liabilities for the offending Covered Officer and the Company.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P17_S0	I, Dean L. Cash, certify that:
1394922_18_ITEM15_P18_S0	The registrant s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
1394922_18_ITEM15_P19_S0	The registrant s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
1394922_18_ITEM15_P20_S0	Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant s internal control over financial reporting.
1394922_18_ITEM15_P21_S0	I, Paritosh K. Choksi, certify that:
1394922_18_ITEM15_P22_S0	The registrant s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:
1394922_18_ITEM15_P23_S0	The registrant s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
1394922_18_ITEM15_P24_S0	Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant s internal control over financial reporting.
